locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the historical context of the Babylonian exile, the linguistic nuances of 'Beulah' (Baal/pregnant), and parallels these with the wedding at Cana and the civil rights movement of Dr. King.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong focus on the Hebrew 'Beulah' and the shift from 'forsaken' to 'delight'.

illocutie.beschrijving: The sermon primarily asserts the reality of God's newness and invites the hearer to recognize it, culminating in a declaration of identity.
voorbeelden: God says: 'For Zion’s sake I will not keep silent!'
The gospel is the excitement of new pregnancy.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from anxiety/fatigue to hope-filled action and joy.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The Spirit is mentioned in the text of Isaiah 61, but not explicitly invoked as the agent of the sermon's current effect.

voorbeelden: The story of the people of God in the Old Testament ends in failure.
Jesus is also at a wedding party.
Martin dreamed us all tougher in dignity.
Imagine: the poet addresses this helpless people.
So ponder that you and I are at this moment.
Go through, go through the gates.
That is all the hard words that begin with 'd' that I could muster!
I want to comment on the second of these images.
God can sing and dance with them for new possibility.
A word has been uttered that is life-changing.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Moderate. The promises are often framed as descriptions of what God does generally rather than direct 'I promise you' addresses.

voorbeelden: The Redeemed of the Lord, (all of us!)
A City Not Forsaken (this city, our city!)
declaratieven.autoriteit: Strong at the conclusion. The preacher moves from 'talking about' to 'naming' the congregation.

indicatoren: Extensive historical retelling of Isaiah and MLK.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of 'newness' rather than a participant in it until the very end.

missende_elementen: Direct divine address (God speaking through the preacher)

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The 'toezegging' is present but often mediated through the examples of others (Isaiah, Jesus, Martin).
voorbeelden: this is a word for you
God calls us to act from our new birthright

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct questions about anxiety and the final naming ceremony.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to diagnose the hearer's state and then to declare their new name.

derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a historical/literary distance that requires a 'bridge' to the present.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General theological truths about the Gospel.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Not strictly legalistic; the directives are grounded in the 'newness'.

voorbeelden: The Holy People (Declarative) -> Go through the gates (Directive).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is late but powerful.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because God calls us... act from our new birthright!

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily as an 'eye-opener' or a 'paradigm shift' through teaching, only becoming sacramental in its final moments.

sterke_punten.effect: Creates a vivid, visceral image of hope.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Sections I, II, III, and IV are almost entirely descriptive.
zwakke_punten.probleem: The 'event' is delayed by long historical parallels.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final section when the preacher says 'that's us!', but much of the sermon is 'talking about' the event.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher acts as a teacher/poet more than a mandatory of a present-tense God until the very end.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is quoted as a historical speaker, but rarely 'speaks' directly through the preacher's present voice.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a witness to witnesses (Isaiah/MLK).
tekstueel_bewijs: All of these bold witnesses testify...

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low. The Spirit is a topic of the text, not the explicitly invoked power of the preaching act.
tekstueel_bewijs: The spirit of the Lord GOD is upon me (quoting Isaiah).

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon aims to be a means of grace by 'breaking the silence of despair'.
tekstueel_bewijs: A word has been uttered that is life-changing.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many past-tense assertives. Needs more present-tense commissives.

specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Through Isaiah, God promises you a new heaven today.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from historical report to present promise.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is 'about' the gospel rather than 'being' the gospel.
voorbeeldzinnen: In the name of Christ, I declare to you: your barren season is over.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Bring the characters into the room.
voorbeeldzinnen: Jesus is not just at a wedding in Cana; He is at this table now, changing your water into wine.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The foundation is solid, just needs to be more direct.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Keep the 'naming' section but expand it.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has brilliant 'locutionary' imagery (pregnancy). To move from a lecture to an 'event', shorten the historical descriptions and increase the direct, present-tense 'toezegging' (promise).

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or the 'appeal'. SAT focuses on whether the preacher actually *performed* the naming of the people as 'Redeemed'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric admires the 'd-word' alliteration; SAT asks if the 'd-words' were actually exorcised by a performative word of grace.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon is a 'report on newness' for 80% of its duration, only becoming 'newness' in the final 20%.

kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High - redefines reality for the hearer.
Very High - this is the 'event' moment.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'prophetic imagination' of others (Isaiah, MLK) which risks making the preacher a curator of old performatives rather than a speaker of a new one.
